IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON EVOLUTIONARY COMPUTATION 

A Review of Automated Parameter Calibration Techniques for Metaheuristic Algorithms
Changwu Huang, Member, IEEE, Yuanxiang Li, and Xin Yao, Fellow, IEEE

Abstract—Metaheuristics are widely used in optimization problems, but their performance heavily relies on the setting of algorithmic parameters. Identifying optimal parameter settings is a time-consuming task, making automation a highly desirable goal. Over the past two decades, numerous automated calibration techniques have been proposed to tackle this challenge. This paper provides an exhaustive overview of existing methodologies for automating metaheuristic parameter tuning.

A novel categorization framework for these techniques is introduced based on their operational structure. The reviewed approaches are categorized into three main groups: basic generation-based methods, iterative refinement procedures, and advanced optimization strategies. 

1   Simple Generation-Based Methods

2   Iterative Refinement Procedures

3   Advanced Optimization Strategies
